grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 柄節【ヘイセツ】scape (of an insect)
kun reading compounds: 柄【がら】pattern, design, body build, figure, physique, essential qualities, character, nature, appropriate to, fitting of, suitable for
ガラが悪い【ガラがわるい】ill-bred, vulgar, boorish
土地柄【とちがら】nature of the locality, character of a place, local colour, local color
柄【え】handle, grip, stalk (of a mushroom, leaf, etc.)
柄鏡【えかがみ】traditional mirror with a handle, popular since the Muromachi period
長柄【ながえ】long handle, long-handled spear, long shaft
柄【つか】hilt (of a sword), haft (of a dagger), handle, handgrip

鎌柄【かまつか】sickle handle, goby minnow (Pseudogobio esocinus), Oriental photinia (species of shrub, Photinia villosa), Asiatic dayflower (Commelina communis), Joseph's-coat (species of amaranth, Amaranthus tricolor)
